entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Progress on Wasm optimization with merged specialization PR and ongoing development
entry.content:
Summary

Wasm specialization merged, test environment improvements, and active WASI runtime development

Activity

  • Wasm number comparison and bigarray operations specialized by Jérôme Vouillon with performance improvements for numeric operations (#1954)
  • Number unboxing across function calls completed by Jérôme Vouillon improving function call performance (#2101)
  • Test environment closed with @hhugo and Jérôme Vouillon discussion on supporting multiple JavaScript engines including deno (#1991)
  • OCaml 5.4 support testing in progress by @hhugo for compatibility validation (#2103)
  • Ongoing WASI runtime development by Jérôme Vouillon with Stack Switching proposal implementation and multiple environment testing capabilities (#1831, #1832)
  • Exception optimization work continues with draft implementation for Wasm backend performance improvements (#2098)
  • OCaml compiler hint consumption advancing with draft PRs for leveraging compiler optimizations (#1721, #1745)
entry.summary: Progress on Wasm optimization with merged specialization PR and ongoing development

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Reference unboxing optimization and WASM primitive type improvements merged, with CI configuration updates
entry.content:
Summary

New OCaml 5.4 testing PR opened, with major optimization work continuing on WASM performance

Activity

  • OCaml 5.4 support testing opened by @hhugo to evaluate compatibility (#2103)
  • WASM exception optimization work continues by Jérôme Vouillon with comprehensive improvements to exception handling (#2098)
  • Stack switching effects implementation ongoing by Jérôme Vouillon based on WebAssembly Stack Switching proposal (#1832)
  • Lambda lifting optimization continues by Olivier Nicole showing performance improvements on large applications (#1886)
  • CI infrastructure improvements with dune unpinning and job scheduling optimizations by @hhugo (#2102)
entry.summary: Reference unboxing optimization and WASM primitive type improvements merged, with CI configuration updates

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Multiple WASM optimization PRs opened with focus on number unboxing and exception handling
entry.content:
Summary

Five new PRs opened focusing on WASM optimizations, with three performance-related PRs merged

Activity

  • Five new PRs opened this week including exception optimization experiments by Jérôme Vouillon (#2098), benchmark testing framework (#2099), and WASM primitives improvements (#2100)
  • Number unboxing optimization completed with Jérôme Vouillon merging cross-function call improvements (#2101) and within-function optimizations (#2069)
  • Reference unboxing feature merged after extensive review addressing optimization scoping and try-catch interactions (#1958)
  • WASM runtime cleanup merged as preparation for future optimizations (#2094)
  • Lambda lifting optimization continues development by Olivier Nicole with measured 1.45x speedup on Bonsai benchmarks (#1886)
  • Runtime API access work by @hhugo remains in draft to address genjsapi integration needs (#2086)
entry.summary: Multiple WASM optimization PRs opened with focus on number unboxing and exception handling

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Bug fixes and WASM improvements with comparison function purity corrections and Unix.times runtime fix
entry.content:
Summary

Week focused on runtime stability with CI fixes, test improvements, and ongoing library enhancement work

Activity

  • Bug fixes completed with Olivier Nicole reverting comparison function annotation changes (#2092) to fix function comparison behavior issues (#2089)
  • WASM runtime improvements by Jérôme Vouillon including Unix.times fix (#2096), call graph analysis corrections (#2093), and runtime cleanup (#2094)
  • CI and testing stabilized by @hhugo addressing Dune 3.20 test failures and lwt compatibility issues (#2095)
  • Test robustness improved with Olivier Nicole making directory-independent test execution (#2090)
  • Ongoing development includes aggressive lambda lifting optimizations (#1886), WASM JavaScript string implementation (#1772), and Windows CRLF handling improvements (#2087)
entry.summary: Bug fixes and WASM improvements with comparison function purity corrections and Unix.times runtime fix

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Major merge of optimization hints framework and compiler improvements affecting WASM target
entry.content:
Summary

Closure optimization merged and WASI runtime troubleshooting discussion ongoing

Activity

  • Closure optimization merged by Jérôme Vouillon omitting code pointer when not used to reduce memory allocation and enable better Binaryen optimizations (#2059)
  • Function type precision improvements ongoing in draft PR by Jérôme Vouillon for WASM environment casting optimization (#1908)
entry.summary: Major merge of optimization hints framework and compiler improvements affecting WASM target

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Single dependency update merged to bump actions/checkout from v4 to v5
entry.content:
Summary

Automated dependency maintenance with GitHub Actions checkout update

Activity

  • GitHub Actions workflow updated by Dependabot to use actions/checkout v5, providing Node.js 24 support and improved performance (#2088)
entry.summary: Single dependency update merged to bump actions/checkout from v4 to v5

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: New PR opened for Windows CRLF handling improvements and ongoing WASM runtime discussion
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened addressing Windows line ending handling, with ongoing WASM runtime compatibility discussion

Activity

  • Windows compatibility improvements with PR opened by @hhugo to fix CRLF handling on Windows systems (#2087)
  • WASM runtime integration discussion continues with @nickbetteridge reporting type mismatch issues when using wasmofocaml with WAMR runtime (#1929)
entry.summary: New PR opened for Windows CRLF handling improvements and ongoing WASM runtime discussion

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Release 6.2.0 with enhanced filesystem support and runtime improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major release preparation with filesystem improvements and API extension work in progress

Activity

  • New runtime access API opened by @hhugo to enable direct access to exported runtime values (#2086)
  • Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API addition under review by @toastal with active discussion on method signatures (#2070)
  • Release 6.2.0 successfully completed by @hhugo including filesystem improvements and compiler fixes (#2085)
  • Filesystem rename implementation merged by Jon Ludlam with comprehensive testing and Windows compatibility fixes (#2080)
entry.summary: Release 6.2.0 with enhanced filesystem support and runtime improvements

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: Critical recursive function inlining bug fix and compiler improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Bug fix activity focused on compiler reliability with swift resolution of critical issues

Activity

  • Critical bug fix for recursive function inlining implemented by @hhugo resolving variable escape errors in complex tail-call scenarios (#2084)
  • Bug report and quick resolution workflow demonstrated with Brendan Zabarauskas reporting the issue with detailed reproduction case (#2083)
  • Ongoing API expansion with @toastal continuing work on Intl.RelativeTimeFormat bindings (#2070)
  • Filesystem improvements by Jon Ludlam implementing rename functionality in fs_fake module (#2080)
  • Release preparation activities by @hhugo updating version information (#2085)
entry.summary: Critical recursive function inlining bug fix and compiler improvements

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Three PRs opened including filesystem rename implementation and runtime fixes, with ongoing discussion about wasm exports and effects compatibility
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened for filesystem improvements and runtime fixes, with one later merged and ongoing compatibility discussions

Activity

  • Filesystem enhancement with Jon Ludlam opening #2080 to implement rename functionality in fs_fake module (opened July 15, later merged July 29)
  • Runtime improvements by Jérôme Vouillon including attempt to restore camlstringof_array function for brr compatibility in #2081 and runtime annotation fixes in #2082 (merged July 21)
  • Compatibility coordination between Jérôme Vouillon and Daniel Bünzli regarding brr library dependencies, with #2081 ultimately closed in favor of fixing brr directly
entry.summary: Three PRs opened including filesystem rename implementation and runtime fixes, with ongoing discussion about wasm exports and effects compatibility

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: Loop optimization improvements and minor release with shape loading bug fix
entry.content:
Summary

Minor release 6.1.1 published with compiler optimizations and CI improvements

Activity

  • Minor release 6.1.1 published by @hhugo with shape loading bug fix (#2076)
  • Compiler loop optimization work merged including enhanced early loop exit support (#2077) and small body detection (#2075)
  • CI infrastructure improvements with apt cache updates by Jérôme Vouillon (#2078)
  • Type analysis updates including small fixes and optimizations (#2073)
  • JavaScript reserved keywords list updated to remove obsolete ECMAScript 3 keywords (#2071)
  • Benchmarks fixed for proper test execution (#2072)
entry.summary: Loop optimization improvements and minor release with shape loading bug fix

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: Major 6.1.0 release with compiler performance improvements and bug fixes plus three new PRs opened
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API addition and advanced number unboxing for WASM

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened this week: @toastal adding Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API support (#2070), Jérôme Vouillon implementing number unboxing within functions for WASM performance (#2069), and Jérôme Vouillon updating JavaScript reserved keywords (#2071)
  • Release preparation completed by @hhugo with version bumps and configuration updates leading to 6.1.0 publication (#2065)
  • Compiler architecture refactored with helper functions moved to toplevel and removal of menhir library dependency for improved build process (cd7dd7a, a734547)
entry.summary: Major 6.1.0 release with compiler performance improvements and bug fixes plus three new PRs opened

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Compiler optimizations focused on switch statements, OCaml 5.4 support, and short variable fixes with warning control improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Focus on compiler optimizations, OCaml 5.4 support, CI improvements, and preparation for upcoming release

Activity

  • @hhugo opened tracking issue for pending PRs required for WASM testing across multiple upstream repositories (#2061)
  • @hhugo created draft ES6 effects testing PR to evaluate impact of ES6 features (#2062)
  • Compiler optimization work delivered through switch statement simplification with performance improvements showing 22% reduction in code size and compilation time for fiat-crypto (#2057)
  • Release preparation activities including changes cleanup (#2060) and CI job name fixes (#2063)
  • Short variable bug fix addressing ES6 compatibility issues with AssignTarget handling (#2064)
  • JavaScript runtime audit completed removing unused variables and improving code quality (#2056)
  • 32-bit CI support improvements adding additional dependencies (#2055)
entry.summary: Compiler optimizations focused on switch statements, OCaml 5.4 support, and short variable fixes with warning control improvements

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Major arity propagation system merged, warning controls enhanced, wasm optimizations delivered, and JS string support progressing
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for Shapes with dune support and biome fixes, while core infrastructure improvements were merged

Activity

  • New PRs opened include Shapes with dune support by @hhugo (#2047) building on arity propagation work, and biome CI fixes (#2049)
  • Infrastructure improvements delivered through CI job name clarification (#2051), Jane Street test updates for OCaml 5.3 compatibility (#2048), and benchmark environment upgrades
  • Long-running feature development continues with JavaScript string implementation by Jérôme Vouillon (#1772), comprehensive function optimizations (#2054), and popover API support by Sylvain Boilard (#1734)
  • API bindings work progressing with CSS Font Loading API implementation by Mesmera (WAFT) (#1833) receiving review feedback
entry.summary: Major arity propagation system merged, warning controls enhanced, wasm optimizations delivered, and JS string support progressing

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Major WebAssembly optimizations and new browser API support with `window.matchMedia` functionality
entry.content:
Summary

WebAssembly compiler optimization focus with method lookup fixes and build infrastructure improvements

Activity

  • WebAssembly method lookup fixes by Jérôme Vouillon addressing separate compilation cache issues and eliminating GETDYNMET cache usage (#2038, #2039)
  • Build and testing infrastructure improvements by Jérôme Vouillon including CI fixes for ppx_css compatibility with sedlex (#2037) and disabling WebAssembly baseline compiler in microbenchmarks for optimized code performance (#2036)
  • Global dead code optimization enhancement by Jérôme Vouillon ensuring IsInt tests retain only blocks, not their contents (#2046)
  • Arity propagation merged by @hhugo enabling function arity computation across compilation units with shape information stored in generated JavaScript (#1594)
  • Ongoing performance work includes Olivier Nicole's aggressive lambda lifting experiments (#1886) and WebAssembly JavaScript string implementation by Jérôme Vouillon (#1772)
entry.summary: Major WebAssembly optimizations and new browser API support with `window.matchMedia` functionality

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: OCaml 5.4 support added, WASM performance improvements with DataView primitives, and new benchmarking framework
entry.content:
Summary

Major version preparation, WASM backend optimizations, and community API discussions active

Activity

  • OCaml 5.4 preparation completed by @hhugo with comprehensive runtime primitive additions for the upcoming release (#2030)
  • WASM performance focus by Jérôme Vouillon delivering multiple optimizations including DataView bigarrays (#1979), integer operations (#2032), and string constants (#2022)
  • Arity propagation between compilation units merged after extensive review, enabling cross-module function optimizations (#1594)
  • Performance benchmarking infrastructure extended with real-world test cases from lexifi-g2pp mathematical computations and bin_prot serialization (#2025)
  • Compiler optimization improvements including better inlining passes and more effective dead code elimination (#2027, #2029)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4 support added, WASM performance improvements with DataView primitives, and new benchmarking framework

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: Compiler optimization improvements with enhanced inlining passes and effects handling plus Dom API additions
entry.content:
Summary

Four new PRs opened while six optimization-focused PRs were merged addressing inlining and effects handling

Activity

  • Four new PRs opened including experimental internal API changes by @hhugo (#2019), wasm string constant optimizations by Jérôme Vouillon (#2022), benchmarking additions (#2025), and effects optimization improvements (#2026, #2027)
  • Compiler optimization milestones achieved with inlining pass improvements by Jérôme Vouillon (#2018), effects handling fixes (#2021), and invariant checking enhancements by @hhugo (#2023, #2024)
  • DOM API expansion with @toastal contributing matchMedia and MediaQueryList support (#2017) addressing issue #608
  • Wasm backend development progressing with string constant optimization and effects configuration improvements (#2022, #2026)
entry.summary: Compiler optimization improvements with enhanced inlining passes and effects handling plus Dom API additions

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: Compiler performance improvements through inlining pass rewrite, deadcode optimization fixes, and UTF-8 encoding bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple compiler optimization merges, ongoing lambda lifting experimentation, and active code review discussions

Activity

  • New PRs opened including prototype system work and performance investigations (#1886 lambda lifting experimentation by Olivier Nicole)
  • Compiler optimization merges completed with @hhugo delivering multiple performance improvements including driver refactoring (#2012), effects debugging adjustments (#2011), and timing enhancements (#2005)
  • Inlining pass rewrite by Jérôme Vouillon achieved production readiness with extensive testing by Ricky Vetter and Ty Overby confirming performance gains (#1935)
  • Arity propagation feature merged by @hhugo improving function optimization across compilation units (#1594)
  • Build system modernization completed with Dune 3.19 adoption and cleanup of deadcode in compiler modules (#1957, #2015)
entry.summary: Compiler performance improvements through inlining pass rewrite, deadcode optimization fixes, and UTF-8 encoding bug fixes

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Major week of performance optimizations and WASM binary output improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Intensive optimization work with 21 PRs merged focusing on compilation speed and code generation efficiency

Activity

  • Compilation speed improvements delivered through multiple optimization passes including faster constant sharing (#1988), enhanced JS variable assignment logic (#1986), and faster free variable analysis (#1989)
  • WASM processing acceleration through binary output support (#2000) and optimized WAT generation (#1992) by Jérôme Vouillon and @hhugo
  • Optimization pass reordering work (#2001) improving compiler convergence and related experimental passes (#1998, #1996, #1995) exploring deadcode and phi optimizations
  • Code quality enhancements including deprecation of polymorphic comparisons (#1981), deadcode elimination improvements (#1978), and queue access optimizations (#1985)
  • WASM runtime improvements with DataView primitives for bigarrays (#1979) and JavaString hash function relocation (#1990) for Firefox compatibility
  • Testing and benchmark adjustments including microbenchmark improvements (#1973) and performance testing infrastructure
entry.summary: Major week of performance optimizations and WASM binary output improvements

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Major compiler optimization improvements with enhanced deadcode elimination, faster coloring, and improved optimization pass scheduling
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive compiler optimization work dominated the week with multiple performance improvements and one ongoing WebAssembly feature request

Activity

  • New feature request opened by Olivier Nicole for passing flags to Binaryen to enable multimemory support for linking with Emscripten modules (#1956)
  • Comprehensive compiler optimization effort led by @hhugo and Jérôme Vouillon with 12 merged PRs implementing major performance improvements across deadcode elimination, optimization scheduling, coloring algorithms, and bytecode parsing
  • WebAssembly bug fixes including Safari 18.4 validation issues reported by Ty Overby (#1975) and integer conversion problems (#1955)
  • JavaScript effects integration improvements with bug fix for Js_error handling when effects are enabled (#1970)
  • Development infrastructure enhancements including benchmark adjustments for better measurement accuracy (#1973) and GitHub issue template improvements
entry.summary: Major compiler optimization improvements with enhanced deadcode elimination, faster coloring, and improved optimization pass scheduling

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Performance optimizations in compiler with specialization improvements, function purity analysis, and dead code elimination enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

New WebAssembly optimizations and reference unboxing PRs opened, with ongoing lambda lifting and parameter unboxing work

Activity

  • New WebAssembly optimizations opened by Jérôme Vouillon specializing number comparisons and bigarray operations (#1954)
  • Reference unboxing implementation completed and merged by Jérôme Vouillon with substantial code improvements (#1958)
  • Function and block parameter unboxing draft PR in progress by Jérôme Vouillon (#1953)
  • Lambda lifting optimizations ongoing by Olivier Nicole with aggressive lifting for performance improvements (#1886) and focused lifting for functions with free variables (#1885)
  • Build system update completed by @hhugo upgrading to Dune 3.19 (#1957)
entry.summary: Performance optimizations in compiler with specialization improvements, function purity analysis, and dead code elimination enhancements

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: New --empty-sourcemap flag, tailcall optimization improvements, debug features, and WASM documentation updates
entry.content:
Summary

Active compiler optimization work and documentation improvements with WASM event handler bug reported

Activity

  • Ongoing optimization work by Jérôme Vouillon with the large inlining pass rewrite #1935 continuing development from previous weeks, including performance benchmarking and code size analysis by @hhugo
  • Compiler improvements delivered through multiple commits including closure location disconnection (acf8bb0), optimization pass simplification (d98717c), and primitive alias delay (8aa2a6a)
  • CI improvements addressing setup-ocaml version issues (f402eb3, 08f230f)
  • Runtime enhancements including hash float normalization (821258d) and string repeat simplification (8e7ad10)
entry.summary: New --empty-sourcemap flag, tailcall optimization improvements, debug features, and WASM documentation updates

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Heavy compiler optimization work with 6 merged commits improving performance and simplification alongside one new PR
entry.content:
Summary

One new inlining rewrite PR opened by Jérôme Vouillon with extensive changes across compiler components

Activity

  • Inlining pass rewrite started by Jérôme Vouillon with comprehensive changes to 15 files (#1935)
  • Compiler optimization theme dominated the week with Jérôme Vouillon delivering 6 merged improvements targeting compilation speed, code generation quality, and JavaScript backend correctness
  • Code quality improvements through polymorphic operations reduction and structural optimizations affecting core compiler modules
entry.summary: Heavy compiler optimization work with 6 merged commits improving performance and simplification alongside one new PR

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Active development week with compiler optimizations, runtime improvements, and CI fixes for OCaml 4.12+ support drop
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for primitive inlining while ongoing optimization work continues with lambda lifting

Activity

  • New primitive inlining PR opened by @hhugo allowing inlining of runtime primitives into generated code (#1928)
  • Lambda lifting optimization continuing development by Olivier Nicole with aggressive lifting for performance improvements (#1886) and selective lifting for functions with free variables (#1885)
  • WASM backend development with closed optimization PR for statically known function calls by Jérôme Vouillon (#1790)
  • CI infrastructure improvements including Cygwin 3.6.1 fixes and benchmarking infrastructure updates (#1933, #1932, #1927)
entry.summary: Active development week with compiler optimizations, runtime improvements, and CI fixes for OCaml 4.12+ support drop

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: PPX infrastructure improvements for ppxlib 0.36 compatibility and experimental WebAssembly exception handling work
entry.content:
Summary

New experimental WebAssembly exception handling PR opened, with ongoing WASM performance optimization discussions

Activity

  • Experimental exception handling PR opened by Jérôme Vouillon implementing exceptions by returning null for WebAssembly backend (#1910)
  • WebAssembly performance benchmarking discussions between Jérôme Vouillon and Olivier Nicole regarding microbenchmark results and missing comprehensive benchmarks
  • Continuation efficiency feature request closed by @hhugo for making WebAssembly continuation resuming more efficient (#1779)
entry.summary: PPX infrastructure improvements for ppxlib 0.36 compatibility and experimental WebAssembly exception handling work

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: Security fix, WASM improvements, and PPX enhancements for object literal support
entry.content:
Summary

Two WASM-focused PRs opened while ES6 compatibility issue was resolved

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened by Jérôme Vouillon focusing on WASM type precision including more precise Wasm types (#1907) and more precise function types to avoid i31 tests for performance improvements (#1908)
  • ES6 compatibility issue reported by @blueblueredred regarding static class fields syntax in runtime code not being compatible with ES6 environments (#1906)
  • Ongoing ppxlib upgrade work by Antonio Nuno Monteiro for ppxlib 0.36 compatibility remains blocked on dependency updates (#1866)
entry.summary: Security fix, WASM improvements, and PPX enhancements for object literal support

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Performance improvements to JavaScript linking and benchmarking infrastructure added.
entry.content: Activity report for ocsigen/js_of_ocaml - Week 12, 2025
entry.summary: Performance improvements to JavaScript linking and benchmarking infrastructure added.

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: Delivered BLAKE2b cryptographic hash support for WebAssembly, fixed critical compiler bugs, and enhanced performance optimization infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened for lambda lifting optimizations while multiple critical compiler bugs and runtime issues were resolved

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened for performance optimization work by Olivier Nicole including aggressive lambda lifting (#1886) and selective lifting for functions with free variables (#1885)
  • PPXlib upgrade attempt by Antonio Nuno Monteiro to version 0.36 remains blocked pending dependency updates (#1866)
  • Critical compiler bug fixes by Jérôme Vouillon resolving double translation assertion failures (#1870), minifier crashes (#1867), and stack overflow issues in double translation
  • Runtime improvements including Int64.ofstring overflow fixes, camlstring_concat corrections for non-JS strings, and DOM keyboard event handling fixes (#1878)
  • WebAssembly source map improvements with proper path rewriting and JSON production separation to prevent double processing
entry.summary: Delivered BLAKE2b cryptographic hash support for WebAssembly, fixed critical compiler bugs, and enhanced performance optimization infrastructure

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Bug fixes for filesystem operations and benchmarking infrastructure improvements with Node.js compatibility updates
entry.content:
Summary

Single new PR opened for template runtime improvements, with multiple bug fixes merged addressing filesystem and build issues

Activity

  • Runtime template PR opened by Sora Morimoto for useTemplate functionality improvements (#1862)
  • Filesystem bug fixes merged addressing pseudo-filesystem parent directory resolution and Bytes.create exceptions (#1847, #1856)
  • Build system improvement with removal of dune subst dependency to enable pinning and CI setup (#1852)
  • Windows compatibility issue resolved with Node.js version recommendation for fstat errors (#1845)
entry.summary: Bug fixes for filesystem operations and benchmarking infrastructure improvements with Node.js compatibility updates

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Implementation of WAT preprocessor, OCaml 4.14.3 support, extended Unix runtime, and resolution of Windows/filesystem bugs
entry.content:
Summary

Five bug reports addressed including Windows fstat errors, filesystem directory resolution, and compilation compatibility issues

Activity

  • Windows runtime compatibility fixed for fstat error on Windows/Node.js environments by John Jackson with stdout/stderr detection improvements (#1845)
  • Pseudo filesystem directory navigation bug resolved where parent directory .. incorrectly pointed to child directories instead of root by @roodni (#1847)
  • OCaml 4.14.3 compilation compatibility issue diagnosed and resolved by Enrico Tassi regarding ce_rec field access in compilation environment (#1843)
  • Reactive table headers bug affecting TyXML tables fixed through reactiveData dependency update by Ali El-Madani (#1837)
  • WASM effects runtime error resolved for Effect.t illegal cast issues by Satoru Kawahara with JSPI API availability improvements (#1839)
entry.summary: Implementation of WAT preprocessor, OCaml 4.14.3 support, extended Unix runtime, and resolution of Windows/filesystem bugs

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Wasm_of_ocaml improvements and bug reports for reactive table headers and WASM effect handlers
entry.content:
Summary

Two bug reports filed covering reactive table headers and WASM effect handler runtime errors

Activity

  • Reactive table headers bug reported by Ali El-Madani affecting jsofocaml 5.8.2 where table headers randomly stop updating when inspected in dev tools (#1837)
  • WASM effect handler runtime error reported by Satoru Kawahara where illegal cast exceptions occur instead of expected uncaught effect exceptions in wasmofocaml 6.0.1 (#1839)
entry.summary: Wasm_of_ocaml improvements and bug reports for reactive table headers and WASM effect handlers

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: New CSS Font Loading API wrapper PR opened and ongoing discussion about WebAssembly development tools
entry.content:
Summary

New CSS Font Loading API wrapper PR opened with comprehensive implementation including examples

Activity

  • CSS Font Loading API wrapper implementation opened by Mesmera (WAFT) as their first contribution to the repository, featuring complete wrapper with examples and documentation (#1833)
entry.summary: New CSS Font Loading API wrapper PR opened and ongoing discussion about WebAssembly development tools

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Major release week with version 6.0.1 bugfix release, DOM HTML compatibility improvements, and two draft WASM PRs opened
entry.content:
Summary

Release preparation activities and two major draft WASM-related PRs opened by Jérôme Vouillon for WASI runtime and effects implementation

Activity

  • WASI runtime implementation draft PR opened by Jérôme Vouillon introducing WebAssembly System Interface support with command-line flags --enable wasi and --enable exnref for compatibility with Wizard engine and wasmtime (#1831)
  • Stack Switching proposal effects draft PR opened by Jérôme Vouillon implementing effects using WebAssembly Stack Switching with Binaryen development version requirements (#1832)
  • Version 6.0.1 bugfix release published by @hhugo containing performance improvements for continuation resuming, effects dynamic switching, and various runtime fixes including Marshal.to_buffer and Unix filesystem operations
  • DOM HTML compatibility issue opened by @hhugo questioning whether Dom_html.window methods should be optdef, leading to the compatibility improvements merged this week (#1830)
entry.summary: Major release week with version 6.0.1 bugfix release, DOM HTML compatibility improvements, and two draft WASM PRs opened

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Major test suite expansion, runtime bug fixes, and enhanced documentation for JavaScript stacktrace features.
entry.content:
Summary

Runtime bug fixes, test infrastructure improvements, and documentation updates with focus on debugging capabilities.

Activity

  • Runtime stability improvements with fixes for integer overflow prevention in runtime operations (053725074395851dd00669db06286e71617d3fef)
  • WASM runtime fixes including object ID refresh during unmarshalling and Windows compatibility for IO tests (e78549ae922ad762e72786da65e84841e4fdc7b6, 3c9e46f0882da8ab8d5963c8093baeb478154ead)
  • Test synchronization tooling updated to better import OCaml test cases (9d744f57ef4b735293a6656af46edba3b22c9c94)
  • Callback testing enhanced with new tests for Js.Unsafe.callback functionality (89cad068ebb19679716fb5b4cbd7a32156d1922f)
entry.summary: Major test suite expansion, runtime bug fixes, and enhanced documentation for JavaScript stacktrace features.

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Major test suite synchronization and runtime improvements including float16 bigarray support and marshaling fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Test infrastructure overhaul with upstream synchronization and runtime stability improvements through marshaling and bounds checking fixes

Activity

  • Test suite reorganization completed major sync with upstream OCaml including effects tests restructuring, new dynarray tests, and specialized bigarray tests (#1805)
  • Runtime stability improved through marshaling object ID refresh fix (#1810) and array creation bounds checking enhancement (522972b)
  • CI infrastructure updates including Windows WASM test flake workarounds and opam package bug fixes (6f590f7, 15ff906)
entry.summary: Major test suite synchronization and runtime improvements including float16 bigarray support and marshaling fixes

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Runtime improvements and Windows CI enhancements for WASM backend plus marshal bug fix
entry.content:
Summary

WASM Windows CI improvements and test infrastructure enhancements with issue tracking

Activity

  • WASM Windows CI improvements delivered with Windows testing support and faster opam-lint (#1800, 3ab3b05, 1729a1b)
  • Test infrastructure enhanced with Jane Street packages update to version 0.18, node wrapper for testing, and new regression test for marshal bug (8d6da57, 3242ea5)
  • Windows compatibility work ongoing to resolve WASM tooling issues including Sys.os_type corrections and asset directory handling (#1797)
  • Test synchronization feature request opened for tests-ocaml directory alignment with upstream OCaml repo (#1804)
entry.summary: Runtime improvements and Windows CI enhancements for WASM backend plus marshal bug fix

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Documentation improvements for Wasm_of_ocaml and test infrastructure updates to OCaml 5.3
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for WASM optimization and build tooling, plus merged documentation and CI improvements

Activity

  • New WASM optimization PR opened by Jérôme Vouillon to optimize statically known function calls (#1790)
  • Build tooling discussion ongoing with Sora Morimoto exploring dune-build-info for version management (#1783)
  • Documentation milestone reached with comprehensive Wasmofocaml manual merged including installation, usage, and primitive writing guides (#1771)
  • CI infrastructure restored for WASM testing after partial revert of previous changes and Ubuntu 24.4 compatibility fixes (#1789, #1795)
entry.summary: Documentation improvements for Wasm_of_ocaml and test infrastructure updates to OCaml 5.3

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: Major runtime improvements with continuation efficiency optimizations and updated ECMAScript compatibility documentation
entry.content:
Summary

New draft PR opened for version management simplification and continuation efficiency issue closed

Activity

  • Draft PR opened by Sora Morimoto for using dune-build-info to simplify version management across packages (#1783)
  • Continuation efficiency feature request completed with @hhugo creating WASM-specific follow-up (#1779) after Jérôme Vouillon closed original request (#1658)
entry.summary: Major runtime improvements with continuation efficiency optimizations and updated ECMAScript compatibility documentation

entry.title: Week 52, 2024: Major effects system enhancement with double-translation feature merged, improving performance when no effect handlers are installed
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple draft PRs continue work on WebAssembly string optimization, OCaml hints consumption, and popover API implementation

Activity

  • WebAssembly string optimization continues with Jérôme Vouillon implementing JavaScript string support in the Wasm runtime (#1772) and exploring embedded Wasm code in JavaScript (#1758)
  • OCaml compiler integration work ongoing with @hhugo developing hint consumption from OCaml compiler (#1721) and physical equality optimizations (#1745)
  • Browser API expansion with Sylvain Boilard implementing the popover API for modern web features (#1734)
  • Runtime optimization experiments including @hhugo working on monomorphic MlBytes representation (#1229) and alternative jsooTop interfaces (#833)
  • WebAssembly exception handling exploration by Jérôme Vouillon with new exception handling instructions (#1759)
entry.summary: Major effects system enhancement with double-translation feature merged, improving performance when no effect handlers are installed

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: Dropped IE support enabling modern JavaScript features and improved WASM runtime with new JSDoc feature request
entry.content:
Summary

Large WASM PR opened for JavaScript string implementation with new JSDoc feature request for TypeScript integration

Activity

  • Major WASM development with Jérôme Vouillon opening comprehensive PR for OCaml string implementation using JavaScript strings, including conditional compilation, performance improvements, and compatibility features (#1772)
  • TypeScript integration request by Sora Morimoto for multi-line JSDoc comments support to enable runtime type checking with TypeScript compiler (#1777)
  • Legacy code cleanup completed with IE support removal affecting DOM event handling, XHR requests, and HTML element coercion across multiple modules
  • Testing improvements delivered through better OCaml version constraints and output file organization for cross-version compatibility
entry.summary: Dropped IE support enabling modern JavaScript features and improved WASM runtime with new JSDoc feature request

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Dom_html API modernization, ECMAScript documentation, and global flow analysis bug fixes merged
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple bug fixes merged, CI infrastructure updated, and build system improvements delivered

Activity

  • Dom_html modernization completed by Jérôme Vouillon removing obsolete Internet Explorer compatibility code and updating event handling to current standards addressing (#1719)
  • Runtime memory leak fixed preventing channel resource accumulation in long-running JavaScript applications
  • Global flow analysis improvements with debugging capabilities added and bug resolution for optimization correctness (#1768)
  • CI infrastructure modernized updating dependency versions, latest binaryen integration (#1767), and wasmofocaml effects support
  • Documentation enhancements with new ECMAScript feature requirements documented (#1763) and minimal Node.js version clarified (#1750)
  • Build system updates including menhir extension upgrade to 3.0 for improved parser generation
entry.summary: Dom_html API modernization, ECMAScript documentation, and global flow analysis bug fixes merged

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Major week with Wasm_of_ocaml merge completion bringing comprehensive WebAssembly compiler and runtime capabilities
entry.content:
Summary

Two experimental draft PRs opened for WebAssembly exception handling and embedded Wasm code

Activity

  • Two new draft PRs opened by Jérôme Vouillon exploring advanced WebAssembly features including experimental exception handling instructions (#1759) and embedding Wasm code inside JavaScript scripts (#1758)
  • Build dependency issue resolved involving sedlex library version compatibility reported and fixed for version 5.9.1 by Sergey Fedorov and @hhugo (#1754)
entry.summary: Major week with Wasm_of_ocaml merge completion bringing comprehensive WebAssembly compiler and runtime capabilities

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Major WebAssembly backend merge with enhanced DOM HTML API improvements and documentation updates
entry.content:
Summary

New PR opened for physical equality hints while major WebAssembly work was merged from ocaml-wasm fork

Activity

  • New PR opened for physical equality hints by @hhugo addressing issue #1372 but currently in draft status with merge conflicts (#1745)
  • Major WebAssembly backend merge completed with massive integration from ocaml-wasm fork bringing complete WASM compilation support including 31,000+ lines of new code across 280+ files
  • Documentation requirements clarification issue opened by @hhugo requesting documentation of minimal Node.js version 16 and ECMAScript feature requirements (#1750)
  • Release 5.9 preparation merged with version bumps and CI improvements including opam constraint adjustments and macOS CI fixes
entry.summary: Major WebAssembly backend merge with enhanced DOM HTML API improvements and documentation updates

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Release week featuring js_of_ocaml 5.9.0 with runtime improvements, JavaScript optimization fixes, and OCaml 5.3 support
entry.content:
Summary

Major release 5.9.0 published with arity propagation feature merged after 8 months, plus documentation bug fix for online toplevel usage

Activity

  • Release 5.9.0 published featuring comprehensive runtime improvements, JavaScript optimizations, and OCaml 5.3 support by @hhugo (#1735)
  • Arity propagation feature merged after 8-month development addressing function arity computation across compilation units with shape analysis and immutability tracking by @hhugo (#1594)
  • Build system enhancements including opam constraint adjustments and test infrastructure improvements for recursive value compilation and primitive checking (#1742)
entry.summary: Release week featuring js_of_ocaml 5.9.0 with runtime improvements, JavaScript optimization fixes, and OCaml 5.3 support

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Draft popover API implementation opened and exception handling performance question resolved
entry.content:
Summary

New draft PR for popover API implementation and resolution of exception handling performance question

Activity

  • Sylvain Boilard opened draft PR implementing the popover API with support for HTML spec compliance (#1734)
  • Exception handling question about camlexnwithjsbacktrace performance resolved with jose r confirming understanding of constant exception special-casing (#1733)
entry.summary: Draft popover API implementation opened and exception handling performance question resolved

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Major repository restructuring with extensive wasm_of_ocaml removal and new DOM API additions
entry.content:
Summary

Repository underwent extensive cleanup removing wasmofocaml components and modernizing structure

Activity

  • Repository restructuring involved moving JavaScript runtime files from runtime/ to runtime/js/ directory and removing extensive wasmofocaml-related code (#1727)
  • Wasmofocaml removal eliminated over 30,000 lines of WebAssembly-related code including compiler binaries, runtime files, and test infrastructure, simplifying the codebase
  • Source map improvements with code cleanup and enhanced Wasm source map handling for better debugging support
  • Documentation updates included typo fixes (#1732) and Cmdliner documentation improvements
  • CI and build system updates with workflow adjustments and dependency updates including Yojson and dune pinning
entry.summary: Major repository restructuring with extensive wasm_of_ocaml removal and new DOM API additions

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocsigen/js_of_ocaml - Week 44, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocsigen/js_of_ocaml - Week 44, 2024

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Major source map infrastructure improvements and compiler optimizations across 67 files
entry.content:
Summary

Draft PR opened for OCaml compiler hints support and source-map feature request issue closed

Activity

  • New draft PR opened by @hhugo to consume hints produced by ocaml/ocaml#13438, bringing support for new OCaml compiler features (#1721)
  • Source-map sections feature request closed after being marked as a good first issue, seeking to implement index map support for better post-processing (#1446)
entry.summary: Major source map infrastructure improvements and compiler optimizations across 67 files

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
entry.content:
Summary

Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization

Activity

  • Complete architectural transformation removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems (4cd7df4)
  • Documentation rewrite completely updating README from wasmofocaml focus to comprehensive jsofocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details (4cd7df4)
  • Runtime system modernization across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions (4cd7df4)
  • Build system cleanup removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications (4cd7df4)
entry.summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime

entry.title: Week 41, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocsigen/js_of_ocaml - Week 41, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocsigen/js_of_ocaml - Week 41, 2024
